blocks.content: Enumeration is the process of extracting detailed information from a target after scanning. In naval style, scanning tells you how many ships are in the sea, but enumeration tells you what crew they have, what weapons they use, and what systems they run.
SMB stands for Server Message Block. It allows file sharing across a network. Enumerating SMB is like checking what storage rooms or cargo holds an enemy ship has left open.

content: Why: To find SMB version, OS details, and server info.
Why: To list shared folders on the target.
Why: To view SMB shares without a password.
Why: To access a specific SMB share if it is open.

blocks.content: We will use the Blue Room & Network Services on TryHackMe to perform real SMB enumeration. Whenever you see TARGET IP, replace it with the IP shown inside the TryHackMe Blue / Network Services Room machine.
>> MODULE 04 COMPLETE. NEXT WE MOVE TO VULNERABILITY ANALYSIS AND SYSTEM HACKING.
